basics.name: Jimmy (Hiu Nam) Lo
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: As early as I can remember, I've been a tinkerer, builder, and techie. At Georgia Tech, I studied computer science and went on to work for several design and web development firms. Most recently, I worked at the DeKalb Library as their in-house programmer, responsible for all facets of their online presence and internal operations. Currently, I'm looking for new technical challenges and a work environment where I can grow. I value good design, elegant code, and learning new things. Visit my blog at jimmylocoding.com or watch my projects on github.com/jimmylorunning.

highlights: Completely revamped the library's website from backend to frontend, making information responsive, accessible, and editable
Created an app for librarians to enter programs for publication on the website's events calendar as well as on TV screens that greet patrons as they enter the library
Built a complete intranet solution to facilitate communication within the organization
Started and created content for DCPLive, the blog, and DCPLink, the newsletter
Created a multi-faceted online presence for the library to reach its patrons on Twitter, Facebook, Flickr, Pinterest, and YouTube
Created and maintained three podcasts delivering original audio content to patrons
